intro: Peddiea africana var. schliebenii, commonly known as the Schlieben's African peddie, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Pedieae and is characterized by its unique, showy inflorescences that resemble small umbels. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun conditions. Its leaves are lanceolate and often have a waxy coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
